episodes.title: Sylvia Day: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Join best-selling author Sylvia Day in a discussion and audience Q&A about One with You

episodes.title: Buzz Aldrin: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Celebrated astronaut and best-selling author Buzz Aldrin talks about No Dream Is Too High: Life Lessons From a Man Who Walked on the Moon.

episodes.title: The Education of Kevin Powell: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Author Kevin Powell discusses his new memoir, The Education of Kevin Powell, with Vibe Editor-in-Chief Datwon Thomas.

episodes.title: NARUTO - ナルト:  クリエーターに会おう
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: 漫画家、著者である岸本斉史が１５年におよぶ連載ベストセラーマンガシリーズの「NARUTO - ナルト」について議論する。

episodes.title: Brian Blessed: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Actor, film star, trained undertaker, unlikely diplomat, secret romantic, martial artist and mountaineer and national treasure, Brian Blessed discusses his autobiography, Absolute Pandemonium. Hosted by Robin Ince at the Apple Store, Covent Garden in London.

episodes.title: Brandon Sanderson: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: The Sunday Times—and New York Times—best-selling epic fantasy author Brandon Sanderson discusses his brand-new Mistborn adventure, Shadows of Self, with Bradley P Beaulieu, the author of Twelve Kings, at the Apple Store, Covent Garden in London.

episodes.title: Nick Frost: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Nick Frost discusses his new book Truths, Half Truths & Little White Lies. The story of his life warts-and-all, the memoir is funny but also dark, exhilarating and movingly honest. Hosted by Chris Hewitt at the Apple Store, Covent Garden in London.

episodes.title: Naruto: Meet the Creator
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Manga artist and author Masashi Kishimoto discusses his 15 years of work creating his best-selling manga series, Naruto.

episodes.title: Batman: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Author Scott Snyder and illustrator Greg Capullo discuss Batman Vol. 7: Endgame, talk about their creative collaborations, and take questions.

episodes.title: Eilon Paz: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Photographer, author, and vinyl lover Eilon Paz along with Rich Medina talk about Dust & Grooves: Adventures in Record Collecting.

episodes.title: William Boyd: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Bestselling author William Boyd discusses his latest novel Sweet Caress at the Apple Store, Covent Garden in London.

episodes.title: Daniel Lubetzky: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Author, KIND Founder and CEO Daniel Lubetzky talks about Do the KIND Thing. The book shares the revolutionary principles that have shaped KIND’s business model and led to its success, while offering an intensely personal look into the mind of a pioneering social entrepreneur.

episodes.title: Boris Becker: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Boris Becker discusses his career and introduces his new book, Boris Becker's Wimbledon. Hosted by Alice Baxter at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: Edith Bowman: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Edith Bowman discusses her new book, Edith Bowman’s Great British Music Festivals, at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London. Edith reflects on some of the greatest festival moments of the last 20 years, and shares her insights from behind the scenes of the UK’s best music festivals.

episodes.title: David Gelles: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Finance journalist and New York Times reporter David Gelles talks about the inspiration behind his new book, Mindful Work.

episodes.title: Brent Schlender and Rick Tetzeli: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Co-authors Brent Schlender and Rick Tetzeli talk about their book Becoming Steve Jobs. The book sheds new light on the colorful and compelling figure who became one of the most famous CEOs in history. Moderated by John Gruber of Daring Fireball. Becoming Steve Jobs is available on iBooks .

episodes.title: Nick Cannon: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Author Nick Cannon talks about Neon Aliens Ate My Homework and Other Poems, his new children’s book that brings together hip-hop and poetry.

episodes.title: Tara Stiles: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Author Tara Stiles and photographer Andrew Scrivani talk about Make Your Own Rules Diet, which helps readers tune into a diet that makes them feel good.

episodes.title: Neil Gaiman: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Award-winning author Neil Gaiman discusses his new book Trigger Warning, a rich cornucopia of horror and ghosts stories, science fiction and fairy tales, fabulism and poetry that explores the realm of experience and emotion at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: Refinery29: Style Stalking
episodes.author: Apple
episodes.summary: Authors Christene Barberich and Piera Gelardi discuss Refinery29’s first-ever book Style Stalking with fashion editors Laura Brown, Aya Kanai, and Preetma Singh.

episodes.title: Rick Riordan: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Bestselling mystery writer Rick Riordan talks about The Blood of Olympus, his fifth title in the Heroes of Olympus series for kids.

episodes.title: Man Booker Prize Winner 2014: Meet the Author
episodes.author: Apple Inc.
episodes.summary: Richard Flanagan, 2014 Man Booker Prize winner, discusses his winning book, and what it's like to win the most prestigious prize in literature in his first public event as winner at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: Tory Burch: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Author and designer Tory Burch talks about her upcoming first book Tory Burch: In Color and shares the inspirations behind it.

episodes.title: David Nicholls: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Bestselling author David Nicholls discusses his latest book at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London. Us tells the story of a family, recounted over the course of what may well be their final weeks together. Spanning nine countries and twenty-five years, the story is epic and intimate, funny and heartbreaking.

episodes.title: Gillian Anderson and Jeff Rovin: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Gillian Anderson talks about her first novel, A Vision of Fire, an epic sci-fi thriller she cowrote with bestselling writer Jeff Rovin.

episodes.title: Jim Lee and Scott Snyder: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Jim Lee, world-renowned comic book artist and co-publisher of DC Comics, and famed comics writer Scott Snyder visited the Apple Store, SoHo to talk Batman: Zero Year. Moderated by Grantland and Deadspin correspondent David Shoemaker, Lee and Snyder discuss the creative process, the future of comics, and why Batman still has that scowl after all these years.

episodes.title: Margaret Atwood: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Margaret Atwood discusses MaddAddam, the last instalment in her speculative fiction trilogy, and her new collection of short stories, Stone Mattress, at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: Mary Beard: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Author and Professor of Classics at the University of Cambridge Mary Beard and award-winning comedian Tony Law discuss her latest book. Hosted at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: Katherine Schwarzenegger: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Author Katherine Schwarzenegger talks about her book I Just Graduated ... Now What?, a go-to guide for recent and soon-to-be grads.

episodes.title: Steven D Levitt and Stephen J Dubner: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Authors Steven D Levitt and Stephen J Dubner share how they challenge conventional wisdom and answer questions about thinking differently. Hosted at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: Sophia Amoruso: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Author and Nasty Gal CEO Sophia Amoruso talks about her memoir #GIRLBOSS, a sassy — but solid — guide to business success for young women.

episodes.title: Ed Catmull: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Ed Catmull, co-founder of Pixar and president of Pixar and Disney Animation Studios discusses his book Creativity, Inc. at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: Jonah Keri: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Jonah Keri talks with sports broadcaster Mitch Melnick about Up, Up, & Away, his new book about the Montreal Expos.

episodes.title: ShaoLan Hsueh: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Chineasy creator and author ShaoLan Hsueh discusses her book at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: Misty Copeland: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Ballet prodigy Misty Copeland reads from her memoir Life in Motion and talks about overcoming obstacles to embrace her dream.

episodes.title: Patricia Cornwell: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: International bestselling author Patricia Cornwell discusses her latest novel, Dust, a thrilling, gripping tour de force at the Apple Store, Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: J.J. Abrams and Doug Dorst: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Filmmaker J.J. Abrams (Star Trek, Lost) and novelist Doug Dorst discuss their unique, multi-layered book, S.

episodes.title: Giada De Laurentiis: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Food Network star Giada De Laurentiis talks with Alton Brown about Feel Good Food, her new cookbook full of healthy, delicious recipes.

episodes.title: Artie Lange: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Comedian and veteran radio personality Artie Lange discusses Crash and Burn, his new hilarious and heartbreaking memoir. Co-writer Anthony Bozza moderates.

episodes.title: Rob Delaney: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Comedian and Comedy Central's "Funniest Person on Twitter" Rob Delaney discusses his book, Rob Delaney: Mother. Wife. Sister. Human. Warrior. Falcon. Yardstick. Turban. Cabbage. Comedian Mike Birbiglia moderates.

episodes.title: Kate DiCamillo: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Multiple Newbery Award winner Kate DiCamillo (The Tale of Despereaux, Because of Winn-Dixie) discusses her new novel, Flora and Ulysses: The Illuminated Adventures. DiCamillo tells her laugh-out-loud story in an exciting new format that mixes the novel with comics- style graphic sequences and full-page illustrations.

episodes.title: Eleanor Catton: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Eleanor Catton, the winner of the 2013 Man Booker Prize, discusses her winning book, and what it's like to win the most prestigious prize in literature.

episodes.title: Soleil Moon Frye: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Author, actress, developer (Moonfrye), and mother Soleil Moon Frye discusses her new book, Let’s Get This Party Started! A DIY guide to throwing amazing kids’ parties, the book features party themes for fairies, pirates, the 80s, luaus, Halloween, and more.

episodes.title: David Sedaris: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: No.1 New York Times bestselling author David Sedaris discusses his  book, Let's Explore Diabetes with Owls. David discusses the complexities of Chinese food and working with monkeys with Jonathan Ross at the Apple Store Regent Street in London.

episodes.title: John Hendricks: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: John Hendricks created the Discovery Channel in 1985 to provide high-quality documentary programming that let people explore their worlds and satisfy their curiosity. John talks with moderator David Lieberman, executive editor at Deadline.com, about his memoir, A Curious Discovery: An Entrepreneur’s Story. The book recounts the struggles and triumphs of turning his passion for documentaries into the world’s most widely distributed cable channel and parlaying its popularity into a global media company.

episodes.title: Ahmir "Questlove" Thompson: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Ahmir Thompson, a.k.a. Questlove, is the drummer and cofounder of the Grammy Award-winning band The Roots, as well as a renowned producer, arranger, and songwriter. Join him in conversation with moderator and co-writer Ben Greenman as they discuss "Mo’ Meta Blues: The World According to Questlove." The memoir tells his story while expounding on his vast and opinionated knowledge of music, as well as important themes in black art and culture.

episodes.title: Neil Gaiman: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Author, screenwriter, graphic novelist and all-round geek idol Neil Gaiman discusses The Ocean at the End of the Lane, his first novel for adults in over eight years. Credited as one of the top living postmodern writers, and winner of the Newbery and Carnegie Medals, his works include The Sandman, Coraline, Stardust, American Gods, a Douglas Adams biography and two Doctor Who episodes.

episodes.title: Porter Gale: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Marketing expert Porter Gale has worked in marketing, advertising, and branding for more than 20 years. In her new book, "Your Network Is Your Net Worth," she shares her philosophy for success: establish, expand, and nurture your connections, both online and off. Learn more about the value of personal connections at this moderated conversation with Porter. Special guest appearance by social media trailblazer and author Gary Vaynerchuk.

episodes.title: Adam Stone: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Join author and educator Adam Stone as he discusses his book, "Pointy Three." Presented in both American Sign Language (ASL) and English, this is the story of a fork who’s missing one of his prongs, but not his brave spirit. Follow Pointy Three on his journey through the land of Dinnertime as he meets characters left and right and looks for a place where he belongs. Adam also demonstrates how to use iBooks Author and answers a few questions.

episodes.title: VJ: The Unplugged Adventures of MTV’s First Wave
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: As the original MTV VJs, Nina Blackwood, Mark Goodman, Alan Hunter, and Martha Quinn, along with the late J.J. Jackson, had front-row seats for the cultural revolution ignited by music videos in the ’80s. Now they’ve collected their memories of the madness in "VJ: The Unplugged Adventures of MTV’s First Wave," a  book that chronicles the early days of MTV.
tags: VJ: The Unplugged Adventures of MTV’s First Wave

episodes.title: Neal Preston: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Join famed photographer Neal Preston as he discusses his book, "Led Zeppelin: Sound And Fury." Made exclusively for iBooks, this stunning digital book provides an unprecedented, interactive Led Zeppelin experience.

episodes.title: Mark Russ Federman: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Former owner and proprietor of famed lower Manhattan "appetizing store" Russ & Daughters, Mark Russ Federman discusses his  book, "Russ & Daughters: Reflections and Recipes From the House That Herring Built." His book chronicles the delightful, mouthwatering story of an immigrant family’s journey from a pushcart in 1907 to the beloved shop on Manhattan’s Lower East Side.
tags: Russ & Daughters: Reflections and Recipes From the House That Herring Built

episodes.title: Clive Davis: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: In the history of popular music, no one looms as large as Clive Davis. His career has spanned more than forty years, and he has discovered, signed, or worked with a staggering array of artists. Join us for a moderated discussion as Clive talks with "Rolling Stone" contributing editor Anthony DeCurtis about "The Soundtrack of My Life"—his star-studded autobiography.

episodes.title: Stephan Pastis: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Stephan Pastis is the New York Times best-selling cartoonist and creator of the comic strip "Pearls Before Swine." Here he discusses his first book for young readers, "Timmy Failure: Mistakes Were Made."

episodes.title: Eddie Huang: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Known as much for his irreverent, irrepressible voice as the steamed buns at his Baohaus restaurant, Eddie Huang is one of the funniest and freshest stars in the food world. His memoir, "Fresh Off the Boat," is a hilarious and insightful mashup of food, culture, family, and the new immigrant experience.

episodes.title: Tyrese Gibson and Rev Run: Meet the Authors
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Tyrese Gibson, actor and multiplatinum R&B singer, and Rev Run, a founding member of pioneering hip-hop group Run-DMC, talk about their book, "Manology: Secrets of Your Man’s Mind Revealed."
tags: Manology: Secrets of Your Man’s Mind Revealed

episodes.title: Brad Tolinski: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: As editor-in-chief of Guitar World magazine, Brad Tolinski has interviewed and profiled some of music’s greatest guitarists. Here Brad discusses, "Light and Shade," an oral autobiography of Led Zeppelin guitarist Jimmy Page.

episodes.title: Jeff Kinney: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Listen in as author Jeff Kinney discusses the latest installment in his hit “Diary of a Wimpy Kid” series.

episodes.title: Rachael Ray: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Rachael Ray is the New York Times bestselling author of more than 20 cookbooks, the host of multiple cooking shows, and the star of syndicated talk show "Rachael Ray." The Apple Store, SoHo hosted Rachael to talk about her latest book, My Year in Meals.

episodes.title: Bruce Pavitt: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Founder of famed record label Sub Pop, Bruce Pavitt is a music historian, professional DJ, and cultural progenitor. His book, Experiencing Nirvana: Grunge in Europe, 1989, is a photo journal and a grunge rock micro-history, an inside look into a crucial eight-day period in the touring life of Nirvana and Kurt Cobain.

episodes.title: Brian Smith: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: For 30 years, Pulitzer Prize-winning photographer Brian Smith’s bold, iconic portraits of famous celebrities, athletes, and executives have appeared in advertising and graced the covers and pages of magazines like Sports Illustrated and Forbes. Brian discusses his book, Secrets of Great Portrait Photography, and pulls back the curtain on the art of creating great images with extraordinary figures.

episodes.title: James Freeman & Caitlin Freeman: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Coffee lovers and food lovers will enjoy this conversation with co-authors of The Blue Bottle Craft of Coffee, pastry chef Caitlin Freeman and founder & CEO James Freeman. The Freemans, along with moderator and journalist Oliver Strand, dig into their book, the world of craft coffee, and a behind-the-scenes look at Blue Bottle, the much-respected coffee micro-roaster that introduced the Japanese-style "siphon bar" and changed coffee in the United States forever.
tags: The Blue Bottle Craft of Coffee

episodes.title: William Low: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: The award-winning painter and illustrator appeared at the Apple Store, SoHo to discuss his gorgeous illustrated book, Old Penn Station. Low explains his digital painting technique and his approach to creating glorious images that have a reputation for exploiting light and color and with which viewers often find an emotional connection.

episodes.title: Hilary Mantel: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Join World-Record holder and four-time Olympic Champion sprinter Michael Johnson as he discusses his career, his best selling book Gold Rush and his upcoming apps.

episodes.title: Bettye LaVette: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: R&B music legend Bettye LaVette talks about her life, her long and storied career in music, and her memoir, A Woman Like Me. LaVette is honest and unflinching with moderator Harry Weinger, touching on the music industry, the creative process, and what it was like to turn her life's stories into a book.

episodes.title: Henry Chalfant: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Photographer and documentarian Henry Chalfant appeared at the Apple Store, SoHo to discuss his book "Henry Chalfant's Big Subway Archive (Volume 1)" with journalist and critic Bill Adler. Chalfant discusses his career documenting graffiti art in New York City and how he used iBooks Author to create his latest work.

episodes.title: Andrew McCarthy: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: In his book, The Longest Way Home, award-winning travel writer and actor Andrew McCarthy takes us on a deeply personal journey. The Longest Way Home reflects his irrepressible taste of adventure and a vivid sense of place, and plays out amid some of the world’s most evocative locales. Andrew engaged in a discussion of the book and took questions from the audience at the Apple Store, SoHo.

episodes.title: Wyclef Jean: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Grammy Award-winning musician, singer, rapper, producer, and politician Wyclef Jean (The Fugees) appeared with co-author Anthony Bozza at the Apple Store, SoHo to discuss his life, his career, and his memoir, Purpose: An Immigrant's Story.

episodes.title: Alyssa Satin Capucilli: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Beloved children's author Alyssa Satin Capucilli is the author of the popular books about the little yellow puppy named Biscuit. On September 15, 2012 Alyssa read from her books and answered questions from an audience at the Apple Store, SoHo.

episodes.title: Amanda Hocking: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Listen as bestselling author of paranormal romance and young adult fiction Amanda Hocking discusses Wake, the first in the Watersong series of novels, and answers questions from the audience at the Apple Store, SoHo.

episodes.title: Chris Colfer: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Hear Golden Globe-winner Chris Colfer ("Glee") discuss his  book, "The Land of Stories," a fast-paced adventure that uniquely combines our modern-day world with the enchanting calm of classic fairytales.
tags: Chris Colfer Land Stories Glee Fairy Tale

episodes.title: Nick Bruel: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Bestselling children's author Nick Bruel reads from two of his Bad Kitty books and answers questions from the audience of children and adults about his creation process.

episodes.title: Justin Halpern: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Join New York Times best-selling author Justin Halpern (Sh*t My Dad Says) for a discussion about his new book, I Suck at Girls, a laugh-out-loud collection of funny and touching stories of his romantic coming-of-age misadventures. Justin will give a reading, share some stories that inspired him, and take questions from the audience.

episodes.title: Kevin Bleyer: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Emmy Award-winning writer for "The Daily Show with Jon Stewart" presents his book, Me The People: One Man’s Selfless Quest to Rewrite the Constitution of the United States of America.

episodes.title: Gregg Allman: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Legendary rocker Gregg Allman of The Allman Brothers discusses his memoir, My Cross To Bear, with co-author and music journalist, Alan Light at the Apple Store, Upper West Side.

episodes.title: Bethenny Frankel: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Bestselling author and TV personality Bethenny Frankel discusses her book, “Skinnydipping: A Novel,” her first work of fiction.

episodes.title: Rachel Dratch: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Former SNL star Rachel Dratch discusses her book “Girl Walks into a Bar...: Comedy Calamities, Dating Disasters, and a Midlife Miracle” with author David Rakoff. Dratch's hilarious memoir looks at her career, her ups and downs, and becoming a mother when she least expected.

episodes.title: Tara Stiles & William J. Broad: Meet the Authors
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Yoga master Tara Stiles dsicusses her book, "Yoga Cures: Simple Routines to Conquer Over 50 Common Ailments and Live Pain-Free," and with William Broad about his book, "The Science of Yoga: The Risks and the Rewards."

episodes.title: Mario Batali: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Famed chef Mario Batali and comedian Tom Papa discuss Mario’s book, "Molto Batali: Simple Family Meals from My Home to Yours."

episodes.title: David Javerbaum: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Catch Emmy Award‒winner David Javerbaum as he discusses his new book, “The Last Testament: A Memoir,” with John Oliver of “The Daily Show.”

episodes.title: Bryan & Michael Voltaggio: Meet the Authors
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: In their much-anticipated debut cookbook, chefs Bryan and Michael Voltaggio of Bravo’s "Top Chef" explore the concept of family by crafting stories illustrated by ingredient-driven recipes, personal experiences, and modern perspectives on food.

episodes.title: John Lithgow: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: John Lithgow discusses his book, “Drama: An Actor’s Education,” which reflects on how his early life shaped his identity and his craft.

episodes.title: Steve Stoute: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Steve Stoute, marketing guru and author of The Tanning of America: How Hip-Hop Created a Culture That Rewrote the Rules of the New Economy, discusses his experiences connecting cultural icons with blue-chip marketers. The event was moderated by Josh Tyrangiel, editor-in-chief of Bloomberg Businessweek.

episodes.title: Robert Ben Garant & Thom Lennon: Meet the Authors
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Robert Ben Garant & Thomas Lennon have made over a billion dollars for the Hollywood studios, banked bushels of cash for themselves, and earned the love and respect of film critics everywhere (that last part is not true) with hit movies like Night at the Museum franchise and The Pacifier.  In "Writing Movies for Fun and Profit: How We Made a Billion Dollars at the Box Office and You Can, Too!" they share their hard-earned insider knowledge on how to structure, pitch, write, and drink with the best of them.

episodes.title: Alan Alda: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Alan Alda's new memoir, Things I Overheard While Talking to Myself looks at the critical points in his life and wonders whether there's any one thing that leads to a life of meaning.

episodes.title: Stephen Colbert: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Stephen Colbert sits down with radio host Jesse Thorn for an insightful conversation about his  book, I Am America (And So Can You!).

episodes.title: George R.R. Martin: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: In this exclusive interview, George R.R. Martin, the best-selling author of the epic fantasy series A Song of Ice and Fire, discusses Dreamsongs, the author's collection of short stories from the past 30-plus years.

episodes.title: James Patterson: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Acclaimed suspense writer James Patterson stops by the Apple Store, SoHo in New York City for a discussion of his latest book, some of his most memorable characters, and his life as a writer of popular fiction.

episodes.title: The Onion: Meet the Authors
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: The authors of Our Dumb World: Atlas of the Planet Earth (and editors of The Onion) give a guided tour of the most important reference work ever written.

episodes.title: Dan Kennedy: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: When McSweeney's contributor Dan Kennedy lands himself a job at a major label, he finds himself in way over his head. Kennedy's hilarious memoir, Rock On, is a power ballad to office life and rock 'n' roll.

episodes.title: Augusten Burroughs: One-on-One
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Augusten Burroughs' memoir, A Wolf at the Table, explores the author's terrifying relationship with his father, as well as the radical pendulum swing between love and hate. Featuring a dramatic reading by Burroughs, the audiobook also includes four original songs by Patti Smith, Tegan Quin, Ingrid Michaelson, and Sea Wolf.

episodes.title: Chelsea Handler: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: She's a stand-up comedian, host of E!'s late night show, Chelsea Lately, and with the release of Are You There Vodka, It's Me, Chelsea, a bestselling author. Chelsea Handler's collection of irreverent and hilarious essays recalls the highs and lows of her life to date.

episodes.title: James Frey: Meet The Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Author James Frey burst onto the literary scene with A Million Little Pieces, the critically acclaimed and controversial account of addiction and redemption.

episodes.title: Miranda July: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: In her mesmerizing collection of short stories, No One Belongs Here More Than You, the multitalented Miranda July portrays a compelling cast of characters who are desperate but unprepared for any kind of human connection.
tags: No One Belongs Here More Than You

episodes.title: Junot Díaz: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Winner of the 2008 Pulitzer Prize for Fiction, Junot Díaz's The Brief and Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao tells the heartwarming story of a resilient Dominican-American family, and explores the endless human capacity to persevere in the name of love.

episodes.title: Chuck Palahniuk: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Author Chuck Palahniuk and director/screenwriter Clark Gregg stop by the Apple Store to discuss Palahniuk's novel, Choke, and its forthcoming film adaptation. In the story, med-school dropout Victor Mancini has found an unusual way to make money: Pretend to choke in a restaurant and the person who saves you will feel responsible for the rest of his or her life. Choke is equally provocative and hilarious.

episodes.title: Candace Bushnell: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Bestselling author Candace Bushnell (Sex and the City, Lipstick Jungle) stops by the Apple Store SoHo to read from and discuss her new novel, One Fifth Avenue.

episodes.title: Mary Pope Osborne: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Mary Pope Osborne's Magic Tree House series continues with another epic adventure. When Jack and Annie receive a special invitation to spend Christmas Eve in Camelot, the time-traveling siblings embark on a quest to save the mythical kingdom from being forgotten forever. Mary Pope Osborne and her husband Will stop by the Apple Store, SoHo, to read (and, with the help of cast from the musical, sing!) from her latest magical tale.

episodes.title: Nick Cave: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Musician and author Nick Cave thrills the audience at the iTunes Festival with a reading from his book, "The Death of Bunny Munro." Now available on iTunes, the audiobook version is read by the Australian rocker himself.

episodes.title: A.J. Jacobs: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary:
Author A.J. Jacobs comes to the Apple Store SoHo to shares how he turned his life into an experiment in book, "The Guinea Pig Diaries." Accompanied by moderator Travis Tonn, Jacobs discusses the various crazy experiments he undertook in the writing of this book. 

From the description: "Among the many adventures: He outsources his life. A.J. hires a team of people in Bangalore, India, to take care of everything in his life from answering his e-mails to arguing with his spouse. He spends a month practicing Radical Honesty—a movement that encourages us to remove the filters between our brains and mouths. (To give you an idea of what happened, the name of the chapter is "I Think You're Fat.") He goes to the Academy Awards disguised as a movie star to understand the strange and warping effects of fame. He commits himself to ultimate rationality, using cutting-edge science to make the best decisions possible. It changes the way he makes choices big and small, from what to buy at the grocery store to how to talk to his kids. And his revelations will change how you make decisions, too. He attempts to follow George Washington's rules of life, uncovering surprising truths about leadership and politics in the 21st century. He also spends a lot of time bowing and doffing his hat.  And then there's the month when he followed his wife's every whim—foot massages, Kate Hudson movies, and all. Depending on your point of view, it's either the best or worst idea in the history of American marriage."

episodes.title: John Hodgman: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: John Hodgman stopped by the Apple Store SoHo to talk about his book, "More Information Than You Require." He reads, and then discusses the book and its origins with Eat, Pray, Love author Elizabeth Gilbert.

episodes.title: Portia DeRossi: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Actor and author Portia DeRossi discusses her unflinchingly honest book, “Unbearable Lightness: A Story of Loss and Gain” with guest moderator Whoopi Goldberg.

episodes.title: Patton Oswalt: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Comedian Patton Oswalt discusses his book, "Zombie Spaceship Wasteland," a fascinating look into his most unusual, and lovable, mindscape.

episodes.title: Shania Twain: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Best-selling author and award-winning country-pop star Shania Twain discusses her memoir, "From This Moment On," an in-depth look at her challenging childhood and her rise to worldwide fame.

episodes.title: Jennifer Weiner: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: New York Times bestselling author Jennifer Weiner discusses her novel, "Fly Away Home." The book tells the story of a politician caught in a personal scandal and its impact on his wife and two daughters—one a high achiever trapped in an unhappy marriage, the other a recovering addict.

episodes.title: Pete Hamill: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Pete Hamill discusses his book, "Tabloid City," which chronicles the extraordinary drama of a fateful day in New York City.

episodes.title: Gena Showalter: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Gena Showalter discusses the 7th installment in her Lords of the Underworld series, "The Darkest Secret."

episodes.title: Susan Orlean: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Hear how Susan Orleanr crafts brilliantly engaging, witty, and passionate narratives about real-life characters.

episodes.title: Brad Meltzer, Michael Koryta, & David Baldacci: Meet the Authors
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: An introduction to three authors who are at the height of their careers. Brad Meltzer, bestselling author of The Book of Fate, talks about his thriller, The Inner Circle. Michael Koryta discusses his supernatural thriller, So Cold the River. David Baldacci's tremendously successful first novel, Absolute Power, was adapted into a film and turned him into a household name.

episodes.title: Melissa de la Cruz & Ally Carter: Meet the Authors
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: : Melissa de la Cruz is the bestselling author of many critically acclaimed and award-winning novels for teens, including the Au Pairs series and the Blue Bloods series. Ally Carter is the author of the best-selling Gallagher Girls series and Heist Society.

episodes.title: Christopher Paolini: Meet the Authors
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Christopher Paolini lets us behind the scenes and into his Ineritance Cycle series of books to learn about his inspiration and how the series became a sensation.

episodes.title: Tim Ferriss: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Tim Ferriss discusses The 4-Hour Body, the result of an obsessive quest to hack the human body. A guru and role model to millions of readers, Ferriss sits for a candid conversation at the Apple Store, SoHo.

episodes.title: Erik Larson: Meet the Author
episodes.author: iBooks
episodes.summary: Sometimes the best way to tell a story about something vast and far reaching is to focus instead on the microcosm. And so it goes with Erik Larson’s "In the Garden of Beasts: Love, Terror, and an American Family in Hitler's Berlin." A book of nonfiction that resembles good fiction, Larson’s latest work looks at Berlin in the 1930s and explores why the world didn’t recognize the Nazi threat until too late.
